name: multiRDP
short_description: Though the RDP classifier is efficient and has a competitive accuracy in classifying gene sequence reads, it employs the binomial model in the training phase but the multinomial in the testing phase. The algorithm proposed the naive Bayesian classifier that uses the multinomial model in both training and testing phases for calculating classification probabilities. A flattening constant for the multinomial model is also introduced to make sure that every probability estimate will be positive for the naive Bayesian classifier.
summary: A naive Bayesian classifier utilizes the multinomial model for rRNA.
